Lefort is proud to announce the successful commissioning of a first Lidex 1300T at the Taiwanese company, Feng Hsin Steel. 

Proof of the growing interest in Lefort machines from steelmakers, this installation also demonstrates the productivity and robustness necessary for companies wishing to process all kinds of scrap metal at high efficiency. 

A great project smoothly conducted by our teams and our local partners. Congratulations!

A new LEFORT Koloss 1000 TS has joined the ranks at Dalton Metal Recycling

A new Koloss, for a brand new yard for the Dalton Group in Central/Western Glasgow. This yard is brand new and designed to give the best layout for Metal Recycling. The electrically powered (4x110kW) giant of a shear is now in place and ready to further enhance the processing capability of the Dalton Group. The machine is extremely quick, due to the 4 large electric motors and three valve blocks, making it a very strong and productive machine ğŸ’ªğŸ½

Restoration of historic SENNEBOGEN machines - former apprentice project with a success story ğŸ”§
Our employees Andreas and Alois started their career at SENNEBOGEN with an extraordinary project: the restoration of historical machines for the opening of the Erich Sennebogen Museum in 2014. âœ¨ 
One of these machines was a SENNEBOGEN S 802 rope excavator, in production between 1958 and 1960. After so many decades, the wear and tear of time had taken a heavy toll on the machine, which had to be dismantled and painstakingly restored. Alongside other historical models, all restored to their former glory, it is a witness to the development of mechanical engineering in our company's history. ğŸ‘
Ten years after the museum opened, Andreas and Alois are still part of our team and have made impressive careers since then. ğŸš€
